verses.text: Now, Israel, listen to the statutes and the judgments that I am teaching you to do, so that you may live, and go in and take possession of the land that the LORD, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
verses.comment: No significant differences; wording simplified to 'listen' and 'statutes and judgments' for clarity.

verses.text: Do not add to the word that I command you, nor take away from it, so that you may keep the commandments of the LORD your God that I command you.
verses.comment: Faithful to original; keeps the phrase 'do not add...nor take away.'

verses.text: Your eyes have seen what the LORD did at Baal Peor. For the LORD your God destroyed from among you every man who followed Baal of Peor.
verses.comment: Retains explicit reference to Baal Peor and historical event.

verses.text: But you who held fast to the LORD your God are all alive today.
verses.comment: Retains the meaning of 'held fast' (clung, remained loyal).

verses.text: See, I have taught you statutes and judgments, just as the LORD my God commanded me, so that you should do them in the land that you are entering to possess.
verses.comment: No significant difference.

verses.text: Keep them and do them, for that will be your wisdom and your understanding in the sight of the peoples, who will hear all these statutes and say, ‘Surely this great nation is a wise and understanding people.’
verses.comment: Wording is made modern and clear.

verses.text: For what great nation is there that has a god so near to them as the LORD our God is to us, whenever we call on him?
verses.comment: Clear expression of Israel’s privilege.

verses.text: And what great nation is there, that has statutes and righteous judgments as righteous as all this law that I am setting before you today?
verses.comment: Retains parallel question and comparison.

verses.text: Only be careful, and watch yourself closely, lest you forget the things your eyes have seen, and lest they depart from your heart all the days of your life. Make them known to your children and to your grandchildren.
verses.comment: ‘Watch yourself closely’ is literal for ‘keep your soul diligently’.

verses.text: The day you stood before the LORD your God at Horeb, when the LORD said to me, ‘Assemble the people to me, and I will let them hear my words, so that they may learn to fear me all the days they live on the earth, and that they may teach their children.’
verses.comment: Horeb is the name for Sinai; retains reference.

verses.text: You came near and stood at the foot of the mountain while the mountain was burning with fire to the heart of heaven, with darkness, cloud, and thick gloom.
verses.comment: ‘Heart of heaven’ is literal for ‘the very heavens’.

verses.text: Then the LORD spoke to you out of the midst of the fire. You heard the sound of words but saw no form—there was only a voice.
verses.comment: Literal for ‘sound of words’; emphasizes no visible form.

verses.text: He declared to you his covenant, which he commanded you to perform, that is, the Ten Commandments; and he wrote them on two tablets of stone.
verses.comment: ‘Ten Commandments’ is literally ‘ten words’ (decalogue); kept as commandments for understanding.

verses.text: And the LORD commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and judgments, so that you might do them in the land that you are crossing over to possess.
verses.comment: No significant translation note.

verses.text: So be extremely careful for your own sake—since you saw no form on the day that the LORD spoke to you at Horeb out of the midst of the fire—
verses.comment: Literal rendering of warning regarding idolatry.

verses.text: that you do not act corruptly by making a carved image for yourselves in the form of any figure—the likeness of male or female,
verses.comment: Explicit list begins here as in original.

verses.text: the likeness of any animal that is on the earth, the likeness of any winged bird that flies in the sky,
verses.comment: Literal animal and bird categories.

verses.text: the likeness of anything that creeps on the ground, the likeness of any fish that is in the water under the earth.
verses.comment: ‘Creeps’ literal for herpetological creatures.

verses.text: And beware, lest you raise your eyes to heaven and see the sun, the moon, and the stars—all the host of heaven—and be drawn away and bow down to them and serve them, things which the LORD your God has allotted to all the peoples under the whole heaven.
verses.comment: Literal for ‘host of heaven’; ‘allotted to all the peoples’ retained.

verses.text: But the LORD has taken you and brought you out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be a people of his own inheritance, as you are this day.
verses.comment: ‘Iron furnace’ is literal for Egypt as a place of testing.

verses.text: And the LORD was angry with me because of you, and he swore that I would not cross the Jordan and that I would not enter the good land that the LORD your God is giving you as an inheritance.
verses.comment: Refers to Moses' exclusion from the land.

verses.text: For I must die in this land; I will not cross the Jordan, but you will cross over and take possession of that good land.
verses.comment: No significant change in meaning.

verses.text: Be careful, so that you do not forget the covenant of the LORD your God, which he made with you, and make a carved image, the form of anything that the LORD your God has forbidden you.
verses.comment: ‘Has forbidden’ is literal for ‘commanded you not to do’.

verses.text: For the LORD your God is a consuming fire, a jealous God.
verses.comment: Standard phrase for God’s holiness and jealousy.

verses.text: When you father children and grandchildren and grow old in the land, if you act corruptly by making a carved image in the form of anything, and do what is evil in the sight of the LORD your God, to provoke him to anger,
verses.comment: ‘Father children and grandchildren’ is literal.

verses.text: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that you will surely perish quickly from the land that you are crossing over the Jordan to possess. You will not live long in it, but will surely be destroyed.
verses.comment: Heaven and earth as witnesses retained.

verses.text: And the LORD will scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left few in number among the nations where the LORD will drive you.
verses.comment: Standard language for exile; literal.

verses.text: And there you will serve gods made by human hands, wood and stone, that neither see nor hear nor eat nor smell.
verses.comment: Retains anthropomorphic limits of idols.

verses.text: But from there you will seek the LORD your God and you will find him, if you search for him with all your heart and with all your soul.
verses.comment: ‘With all your heart and soul’ is preserved phrase.

verses.text: When you are in distress and all these things come upon you, in the latter days you will return to the LORD your God and obey his voice.
verses.comment: ‘In the latter days’ translates the Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: For the LORD your God is a compassionate God. He will not leave you or destroy you or forget the covenant with your fathers that he swore to them.
verses.comment: ‘Compassionate’ is literal for ‘merciful’ or ‘gracious’.

verses.text: For ask now about the former days that were before you, since the day that God created man on the earth, and ask from one end of heaven to the other, whether such a great thing as this has ever happened or was ever heard of.
verses.comment: Phrase ‘from one end of heaven to the other’ is retained.

verses.text: Has any people ever heard the voice of a god speaking out of the midst of the fire, as you have heard, and lived?
verses.comment: ‘Voice of a god (elohim)’ is literal.

verses.text: Or has any god attempted to go and take for himself a nation from within another nation, by trials, by signs, by wonders, by war, by a mighty hand and outstretched arm, and by great terrors, as all that the LORD your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
verses.comment: ‘Trials...signs...wonders’ kept parallel as in Hebrew.

verses.text: To you it was shown, so that you might know that the LORD is God; there is no other besides him.
verses.comment: Emphasis on monotheism retained.

verses.text: Out of heaven he made you hear his voice, to instruct you. On earth he let you see his great fire, and you heard his words out of the midst of the fire.
verses.comment: ‘To discipline/instruct you’ literal for ‘to teach you’.

verses.text: And because he loved your fathers and chose their offspring after them, he brought you out of Egypt with his own presence and by his great power,
verses.comment: ‘With his own presence’ is literal for ‘by his face.’

verses.text: driving out before you nations greater and mightier than you, to bring you in, to give you their land for an inheritance, as it is today.
verses.comment: ‘Greater and mightier than you’ is original phrasing.

verses.text: Know therefore today, and take it to heart, that the LORD is God in heaven above and on the earth below; there is no other.
verses.comment: ‘Take it to heart’ is literal for ‘return it to your heart.’

verses.text: So you shall keep his statutes and his commandments, which I command you today, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land that the LORD your God is giving you for all time.
verses.comment: ‘For all time’ is literal for ‘all the days.’

verses.text: Then Moses set apart three cities across the Jordan, toward the sunrise,
verses.comment: Literal ‘toward the sunrise’ for east.

verses.text: so that anyone who killed his neighbor unintentionally, without having hated him in the past, could flee there; so that by fleeing to one of these cities, he might save his life:
verses.comment: Wording clarifies ‘unintentionally’ and purpose of asylum.

verses.text: Bezer in the wilderness, on the plateau, for the Reubenites; Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.
verses.comment: Retains tribe and territory names.

verses.text: Now this is the law that Moses set before the children of Israel.
verses.comment: Transitional summary verse.

verses.text: These are the testimonies and the statutes and the judgments that Moses spoke to the children of Israel when they came out of Egypt,
verses.comment: Wording reflects legal terminology from original.

verses.text: beyond the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of Sihon the king of the Amorites, who lived at Heshbon, whom Moses and the sons of Israel defeated when they came out of Egypt.
verses.comment: Place names and historical context retained.

verses.text: They took possession of his land, and the land of Og king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan toward the sunrise,
verses.comment: ‘Toward the sunrise’ is literal for ‘east.’

verses.text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the Valley of Arnon, as far as Mount Sion (that is, Hermon),
verses.comment: References both Hebrew and alternate name (Hermon).

verses.text: together with all the Arabah on the east side of the Jordan, as far as the Sea of the Arabah, beneath the slopes of Pisgah.
verses.comment: ‘Arabah’ and ‘Sea of the Arabah’ are literal; explained as context.
